trans-unit.source: Represents a tabular data source view on XML data for an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> control can present its underlying data in both tabular and hierarchical format to Web server controls that bind to it.

Controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> to bind to XML data and present it in list or tabular form, while controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView>, bind to XML data and present it in hierarchical form.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> creates each view type internally through different code paths.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource.GetView%2A> method is called on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource>, an XmlDataSourceView is created by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource.GetHierarchicalView%2A> method is called, an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlHierarchicalDataSourceView> is created.

The XmlDataSourceView class is provided for Web server controls that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> and bind to lists and tabular data, while the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlHierarchicalDataSourceView> is provided for Web server controls that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> and bind to hierarchical data.
Internally, all data-bound control methods call the `Select` method on whichever data source view object is returned.
Like all <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> helper objects, the XmlDataSourceView defines the operations that the data source can perform with the underlying data.

Because the XmlDataSourceView class only overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView.Select%2A> method, the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> control does not support update, insert, or delete operations.

Because the XmlDataSourceView class is sealed, you cannot extend the XmlDataSourceView class to add this functionality, but you can derive a data source control from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> and a view from <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> if you require additional functionality.

Initializes a new named instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSourceView"></xref> class, and associates the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource"></xref> with it.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource"></xref> that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSourceView"></xref> is associated with.
Retrieves a list of data rows from the underlying XML.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object that is used to request operations on the data beyond basic data retrieval.
